member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.ClydeFileHandler
member.summary: A class designed to handle files exported by the Clyde library.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.ClydeFileHandler.UpdateGUIAction
member.summary:
A delegate action that is called when the GUI needs to update. This can safely be for contexts that do not have a GUI, as it is used for the SK Animator Tools UI.
Pass in for arguments to make their data remain unchanged.
This is designed to work with the UI offered by SK Animator Tools V2. The parameters are as follows:
string fileName (the name of the file that was opened)
string isCompressed (a string of true/false, yes/no, etc.)
string formatVersion (represents clyde file version. Classic, Intermediate, or VarInt for example)
string type (the base class, e.g. ModelConfig, AnimationConfig, ScriptedConfig)

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.ClydeFileHandler.MultiplyScaleByHundred
member.summary:
Multiplies the scale of exported models by 100. This is really handy for a lot of models but may cause others to be huge.
This is by default since it's used more than it isn't.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.ClydeFileHandler.HandleClydeFile(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Collections.Generic.List{ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D},System.Boolean,System.Object,System.Boolean,com.threerings.math.Transform3D)
member.summary:
Takes in a representing a file that was created with the Clyde library.
This will throw a if anything goes wrong during reading.
member.param: The file to load and decode.
A list containing every processed model from the entire hierarchy. This list should be defined by you and then passed in.
If , this will update the main GUI display data for the base loaded model. If the GUI is not defined (e.g. this is being used in a library) this will do nothing.
Intended for use if is , this is the parent Data Tree element to add this model into (so that the hierarchy can be constructed). This should be a , a , or a .
If , the name of the loaded file will be displayed in the tree hierarchy's root node, e.g. model.dat

Intended to be used by reference loaders, this specifies an offset for referenced models. All models loaded by this method in the given chain / hierarchy will have this transform applied to them. If it doesn't exist, it will be created.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.ModelConfigBrancher
member.summary: A class that takes in a , determines its subtype (e.g. , , etc.), and handles the data appropriately.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.ModelConfigBrancher.HandleDataFrom(System.IO.FileInfo,com.threerings.opengl.model.config.ModelConfig,System.Collections.Generic.List{ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D},ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject,System.Boolean,com.threerings.math.Transform3D)
member.summary: Sends an arbitrary into the data brancher and processes it.
member.param: The file that the given came from.
The itself.
A list containing every processed model from the entire hierarchy.
The current element in the data tree hierarchy to use.
If , the name of the implementation will be displayed instead of the file name. Additionally, it will not have its implementation property.

Intended to be used by reference loaders, this specifies an offset for referenced models. All models loaded by this method in the given chain / hierarchy will have this transform applied to them. If the value passed in is , it will be substituted with a new .

member.summary: A utility function that iterates through all of the nodes recursively, as some may store mesh data.
member.param: The file where the is stored.
The parent node to iterate through.
The of all models ripped from the source .dat file in this current chain (which may include references to other .dat files)
The latest transform that has been applied. This is used for recursive motion since nodes inherit the transform of their parent.
If defined, a skin was located inside of this model, and these nodes serve as its bones.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.Model.GeometryConfigTranslator.BoneDataContainer.BoneIndices
member.summary: Bone indices are an array of four values. It traverses the chain of bones. An index of 0 means stop traversing (this is because bone 0 is always %ROOT%).

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.DataHandlers.Model.GeometryConfigTranslator.BoneDataContainer.BoneWeights
member.summary: Bone weights are an array of four values. These values correspond to a bone index.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ClassNameStripper
member.summary: A utility dedicated to taking in Java classnames and breaking them down into parts.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ClassNameStripper.GetSplitClassName(java.lang.Class)
member.summary:
Returns a array of the class name. This array always has a very specific structure:
[0]=Class Name
[1]=Subclass Name
If a class does not have a subclass (denoted with a $ in Java classnames), the array will have a Length of 1. Returns if the string does not have a locatable instance of '.'
member.param: The to get the name of.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ClassNameStripper.GetWholeClassName(java.lang.Class)
member.summary:
Returns a that contains everything after the last index of .. This does not filter out subclasses (e.g. MyClass0$MySubclass0) and will return the string containing the $ and everything.
Returns if the string does not have a locatable instance of '.'
member.param: The to get the name of.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ClassNameStripper.GetBaseClassName(java.lang.Class)
member.summary: An alias method that calls and returns the first index (the base class name), or if '.' could not be found in the .
member.param: The to get the name of.

[0]=Class Name

If a class does not have a subclass (denoted with a $ in Java classnames), the array will have a Length of 1. Returns if the string does not have a locatable instance of '.'
member.param: The classname to parse.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.AsyncMessageBox
member.summary: Provides a method to asynchronously display a message box. Both methods will do nothing if this class's primary parameter, , is .

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.AsyncMessageBox.IsInGUIContext
member.summary:
If , will not do anything.
This should be set to in contexts where there is a GUI accompanied with the program.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.AsyncMessageBox.ShowAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons,System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxIcon)
member.summary:
Asynchronously show a message box (show a message box without causing the GUI to stop updating, allowing stuff to work in the background).
This also allows the user to interact with the GUI before closing the message box, as a side effect.
This task will return if is !
member.param: The text to display in the body of the message box.
The title displayed at the top of the message box.
The buttons used in the message box (e.g. OK)
The icon to display on the left side of the message box.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.AsyncMessageBox.Show(System.String,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons,System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxIcon)
member.summary:
Synchronously show a message box. This is virtually identical to calling , with the exception that it will return if is .
Consider using if you wish to allow the program to continue functioning and accept inputs while the dialog is open.
member.param: The text to display in the body of the message box.
The title displayed at the top of the message box.
The buttons used in the message box (e.g. OK)
The icon to display on the left side of the message box.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject
member.summary: A class that represents a data tree object. It is a basic container with a parent/child hierarchy as well as other applicable data.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.Parent
member.summary:
The that contains this instance, or null if this is a root instance.
Setting this will update the children of the applicable objects (remove this from the children of the old parent (if applicable), add this to the children of the new parent (if applicable)) automatically.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject._Parent
member.summary: The internal reference of the parent. Do not change this internally, and instead change , as it properly updates the object hierarchy.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.Locked
member.summary: If true, the property of this cannot be changed and will always be null.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.Children
member.summary: All s that are first-level descendants of this object (this does NOT include nested objects).

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject._Children
member.summary: An internal reference to the children of this .

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.ImageKey
member.summary:
The image key for this which defines the icon displayed to the left of the item in the data tree.
The default is which represents a generic hierarchy element.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.Text
member.summary: The text displayed in the data tree for this object.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.DisplaySingleChildInline
member.summary: Internal compatibility for casts between this and

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.CreatedFromProperty
member.summary: If true, this was cast from a .

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.Properties
member.summary:
The properties of this object. When the associated node is selected, the properties menu will update.
The method in which this is displayed is via creating the given s in the Properties menu hierarchy, and then adding a child with no icon containing the associated .

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.ClearAllChildren
member.summary:
Iterates through all children of this and sets their property to .
This preserves the hierarchy of the children, so if a child object has its own children, their s will remain unchanged.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.Dispose
member.summary: Sets the property of this to , locks the property, and then calls on all children.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.AddChild(ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject)
member.summary: Adds the given child to this 's children.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.RemoveChild(ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject)
member.summary: Removes the given child from this 's children.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.ToTreeNode
member.summary: Converts this into a . This does NOT add any children. If you need to keep the hierarchy, use

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.ConvertHierarchyToTreeNodes
member.summary:
Converts this and all children into an identical hierarchy of objects, and then returns this object as a with all of the proper children.
This also connects events to being clicked so that they fire the associated events in .

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject.CreateHierarchy(ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.DataTreeObject,System.Windows.Forms.TreeNode)
member.summary: The internal variant of that handles the recursion.

member.summary:
An alias method used to add a property with a generic icon to (omitting the need to create a )

The image displayed next to the property name.

member.summary:
The image key for this which defines the icon displayed to the left of the item in the data tree.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage
member.summary:
An enum that represents the available icons in the data tree. Certain images are not part of the stock Silk image package.
Silk Images come from https://famfamfam.com/
Note to self: Keep this list updated, and ensure its order is identical to the order in which they are defined by the generated code.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Generic
member.summary: A blue square representing a generic object. Intended to represent an object of an unknown type.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Object
member.summary: An icon of a data tree with a single parent object containing two children. An alternative to that serves the same purpose.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Scene
member.summary: A picture of a the globe, intended to represent an entire scene, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Sky
member.summary: A picture of the sky, intended to represent a skybox object, specifically a

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Model
member.summary: A wooden box representing an entire model. Intended to represent a model.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.ModelSet
member.summary: A set of three bricks, each with a unique color. Intended to represent a set of several models grouped together.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Articulated
member.summary: An icon of a person. Intended to represent articulated models, which have bones and often animations, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Billboard
member.summary: An icon of an application window. Intended to represent a billboard GUI element.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Static
member.summary: A single building brick. Intended to represent a static model (just geometry and nothing else), specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.MergedStatic
member.summary: A set of three building bricks. Intended to represent a bulk collection of several static models, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Sound
member.summary: A picture of a speaker. Intended to represent a sound emitter object.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Attachment
member.summary: A picture of an electric plug. Intended to represent an external object that attaches to another model in its current context, for instance, the Thwacker Gremlin model has an attachment for their hammer. The hammer should use this icon in this context.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Derived
member.summary: A picture of two objects with arrows pointing between them. Intended to represent a derived model class, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Conditional
member.summary: A picture of an arrow that diverges. Intended to represent an element that determines conditional attributes in gameplay, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.CameraShake
member.summary: A picture of a camera with a small lightning bolt in the lower right corner. Intended to represent an element that causes the user's camera to shake in gameplay.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Generated
member.summary: A picture of a PC with a small plus symbol in the lower right corner. Intended to represent a model that is generated on the fly from a set of parameters.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Schemed
member.summary: A picture of an application window with a small pencil in the lower right corner. Intended to represent a schemed object, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.SchemedModel
member.summary: A picture of a single building brick with a small pencil in the lower right corner. Intended to represent a schemed model, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Animation
member.summary: A picture of a snippet of film. Intended to represent an animation, specifically a .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Scripted
member.summary: Intended to represent a scene object that has code running within it, usually for gameplay purposes.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.TimeAction
member.summary: Intended to represent an extension of that runs on a timer

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Config
member.summary: A generic icon of a cog. Used for any extra data that is best described as configuration data.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Shading
member.summary: A generic icon of diagonal hashes. Internally this is used to represent fog.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Reference
member.summary: An icon of a hand pointing to a miniature variant of , intended to represent an external reference to another model.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Array
member.summary: An icon of a piece of paper with a blue <> pattern on it.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Texture
member.summary: An icon of a framed picture intended to represent an image texture.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Variant
member.summary: An icon of a cardboard box intended to represent a variation of a model.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Light
member.summary: A picture of a lightbulb. Intended to represent a source of light.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Value
member.summary: A picture of a hand pointing to a text box containing an arbitrary value.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.Interface.SilkImage.Triangle
member.summary: A blue triangle, intended to represent more rudimentary components of models (e.g. sub-models in a static model).

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ResourceDirectoryGrabber
member.summary: A utility class that looks at directory information to try to find the rsrc folder.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ResourceDirectoryGrabber.ResourceDirectory
member.summary: A reference to the rsrc directory.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ResourceDirectoryGrabber.ResourceDirectoryPath
member.summary:
Returns as its string path. It will always end in a slash. This enforces the use of forward slashes (/) so that it works with references.
Returns if is .

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ResourceDirectoryGrabber.GetFormattedPathFromRsrc(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Takes and climbs up its directory tree until it locates a folder named rsrc. It will then return the path starting from rsrc and ending at this file.
The returned path will always use forward slashes.
member.param: The file that is presumably a descendant of the rsrc directory.
If false, the directory path will NOT start with rsrc/.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.ResourceDirectoryGrabber.GetDirectoryDepth(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a path that uses forward slashes, going folders up. A depth of 1 will return the parent directory, a depth of 2 will return the parent of the parent directory, and so on.
member.exception: Thrown if depth is less than 1.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper
member.summary:
A hacky class that can read the raw binary of a Clyde file and find its implementation.
When files are read by , their implementation is cast into a , or is made null if that implementation doesn't exist. This is particularly problematic for Spiral Knights, where player knight models use the unique ProjectXModelConfig that does not exist in this library since Spiral Knights defines it instead. This class allows us to see that it's using this class.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.HackyGetImplementation(System.IO.FileInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
A very hacky method of returning the implementation of this model in its string form so that if Clyde can't read it, we can still see its name. This returns the full class name.
This is only functional for extensions of .

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.IsValidClydeFile(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Returns if the input represents a file exported by Clyde. This tests the header of the file.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.Utility.VersionInfoScraper.GetCosmeticInformation(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Returns three , in order, the compression status (as a , "Yes" or "No"), the version name (user friendly), and the implementation.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.StringExtension.AfterIndexOf(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a of everything after the first located instance of . This does not include the sequence. For instance, if the text cool.beans.nice.meme is input and the method is called with a parameter of nice. for , the return value will be meme
Returns if could not be found.
member.param: The string to search.
The text to locate.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.StringExtension.AfterLastIndexOf(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a of everything after the last located instance of . This does not include the sequence. For instance, if the text cool.beans.nice.meme is input and the method is called with a parameter of nice. for , the return value will be meme
Returns if could not be found.
member.param: The string to search.
The text to locate.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.Vector2
member.summary:
Stores three values that represent a coordinate in 3D space.
Unlike , this does not contain any vector math methods. This is strictly for data storage.

member.summary: The X component of this which generally represents left or right positions relative to the world.

member.summary: The Y component of this which generally represents upward or downward positions relative to the world.

member.param: The float array to be translated into a array.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.Vertex.FromFloatArray(System.Single[],System.Single)
member.summary:
Returns a list of s composed of the given float array, taking each value out in triplets. The weight of each will be set to .
Throws if the float array's length is not divisible by three.
member.param: The float array to be translated into a array.
The weight to give to each vertex, which is used in the context of bone information.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.Vertex.FromFloatArray(System.Single[],System.Single[])
member.summary:
Returns a list of s composed of the given float array, taking each value out in triplets.
Throws if the float array's length is not divisible by three, or if the length of the weight array isn't the same as the result array.
member.param: The float array to be translated into a array.
A list of the weights to give the resulting instances.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup
member.summary: Represents a vertex group, which is used for rigged models. All stored vertices simply represent a vertex that has a weight in a given bone group. As such, if a vertex has a weight value less than 1, it will be a duplicate of at least one other vertex in one other vertex group.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.Vertices
member.summary: All of the vertices stored in this VertexGroup. These ARE unique objects (not unique positions in space) since this is a representation of bone data. If you need to access the full geometry (and not every vertex used by a given bone), do it through , since these vertices are not affected by transforms which may drastically malform the output.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.Indices
member.summary:
The indices in this vertex group. These refer to the triangles in this , but are the indices used by the whole model otherwise.
Please note that certain indices in this array may be duplicated (or, the same exact index will appear up to 4 times in a row). If this is the case, ignore subsequent instances of the same number. For instance, this array may contain 1 2 2 2 3 3 4, and should turn into 1 2 3 4 after you trim it yourself.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.Name
member.summary: The name of this vertex group, which should be identical to the node it corresponds to.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.#ctor
member.summary: Construct a new with default properties.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Structs.VertexGroup.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Construct a new with the given name.

member.name: T:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D
member.summary: A unified representation of a model. Since various implementations from Clyde may store data differently, this provides a common interface.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.ExporterBindings
member.summary: A list of bindings from s to a singleton of their applicable .

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Name
member.summary: The display name for this model, used in exporting (i.e. this is the name that will show up in Blender or any other modelling software.)

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Source
member.summary: A reference to the file that the model here came from. This is used to reference textures and other path-dependent extra data.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Transform
member.summary: The transformation to apply to the model data. By default, this is the identity transformation (so no transform).

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.HasDoneTransformation
member.summary: If true, then has been applied to all .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Vertices
member.summary:
The vertices that make up this 3D model. Generally speaking, this should be used if the model is not rigged.
Consider using to access the geometry of rigged models, do mind some vertices may be duplicated.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Normals
member.summary: The normals that make up this 3D model.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.UVs
member.summary: The UV coordinates.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Indices
member.summary: The indices that define triangles.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.VertexGroups
member.summary: All of the vertex groups in this model, represented as a list of indices. These indices reference .

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.BoneNames
member.summary:
A list of every bone name in this model. Unlike the list provided in Clyde geometry, the first element (index 0) of this list is null.
This allows easier bone indexing when observing vertex groups since all that needs to be done is testing if the name is null (0 denotes "not in a bone group")

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.BoneIndices
member.summary:
The indices for bones. These correspond to an entry in the modified list.
If you need to find the bone for a given vertex, search instead, as s contain bindings to bones.

member.name: F:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.BoneWeights
member.summary:
The weights for bones.
If you need to find the weight of a vertex for a given bone, search instead.

member.name: P:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.HasBoneData
member.summary:
This should be if this has bone data. If it is false, will not do anything.
Ensure this is only set to if , , and are all populated properly.

member.name: M:ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.Model3D.Export(System.IO.FileInfo,ThreeRingsSharp.XansData.ModelFormat)
member.summary: Exports this model in a given format, writing the data to the target
member.param: The file that will be written to.
The file format to use for the 3D model.

member.summary:
Takes and applies it to , as well as every in each individual . This also normalizes the weights of vertices across all vertex groups.
This can only be called once.

member.summary: Frees all information used by this .
